clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison Of Clinical Efficacy Of A Herbal And A Non-Herbal Mouthwash On Dentinal Hypersensitivity
clinical_study.official_title: COMPARISON OF CLINICAL EFFICACY OF A HERBAL AND A NON HERBAL MOUTHWASH ON DENTINAL HYPERSENSITIVITY: A TRIPLE MASKED RANDOMIZED CONTROLLED CLINICAL TRIAL

lead_sponsor.agency: Government Dental College and Research Institute, Bangalore

collaborator.agency: Himalaya Drug Company Research and Development, Makali, Bangalore, India

clinical_study.source: Government Dental College and Research Institute, Bangalore

brief_summary.textblock: Aim of this study was to assess and compare the efficacy of a commercially available novel herbal mouthwash containing potassium nitrate on Dentinal Hypersensitivity (DH) compared to a placebo and non herbal potassium nitrate over a period of 12 weeks.

detailed_description.textblock: A total of 120 subjects were divided into 3 groups randomly. Group 1 was given the placebo mouthwash, Group 2 was given the herbal mouthwash ( Hiora K, which contains potassium nitrate derived from Suryakshara plant) and Group 3 was given the non herbal mouthwash (Containing non herbal potassium nitrate). Sensitivity scores (VAS score) were recorded at baseline, 3 weeks, 6 weeks and 12 weeks.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Visual Analogue Scale score for Dentinal Hypersensitivity
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change in VAS score from Baseline to 12 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Based on a 10-cm VAS score which was used to measure tooth sensitivity, a pain-free response was allotted a score of zero whereas a score of 10 was given to subjects with excruciating pain or discomfort.

intervention.description: 15 ml placebo mouthwash prescribed and VAS score assessed at Baseline, 3 weeks, 6 weeks and 12 weeks
15 ml Herbal mouthwash prescribed and VAS score assessed at Baseline, 3 weeks, 6 weeks and 12 weeks
15 ml Non Herbal mouthwash prescribed and VAS score assessed at Baseline, 3 weeks, 6 weeks and 12 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with a history of DH caused by gingival recession or cervical erosion were selected at baseline. Subjects with a minimum 20 natural permanent teeth and at least two teeth with a VAS score of â‰¥4 were included in the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- of teeth with caries, defective restorations, chipped teeth and deep periodontal pockets (probing depth >4 mm). Also, the subjects who had undergone periodontal surgery within the previous six months, and those with orthodontic appliances or bridge work that would interfere with evaluation were excluded. Subjects with the presence of occlusal overload or occlusal adjustment recently made in the tooth to be studied were also excluded. Subjects who had undertaken treatment with any product that could influence the DH of the patient in the 30 days prior to baseline were excluded. Also, the subjects with allergy to the ingredients used in the study or exhibiting any gross oral pathology, eating disorders, chronic disease, pregnancy and lactation, acute myocardial infarction within the past six months, uncontrolled metabolic disease, major psychiatric disorder, heavy smoking or alcohol abuse, any systemic disease or any disease requiring repeated or regular analgesia, anti-inflammatory drugs, or antihistamines were excluded from the study.
